subtitle: An elegant recipe with the fish served in a wine sauce with grapes.

method.text: Fillet the fish. Fold the fillets in half. Season. Place in an ovenproof, lightly buttered earthenware dish. Set aside.

To make the stock: Wash the remaining bones of the fish, fold into three and put in a pan. Add enough cold water to cover. Add the chopped leek, chopped onion, celery, peppercorns and half the white wine. Bring to the boil and simmer for 20 min. Strain and reserve the stock.
Finely dice the half onion. Place in the earthenware dish with the fish. Add remaining white wine and half the stock.
Cover with lightly buttered greaseproof paper. Place in the oven for 8-10 min.

Pass the remaining fish stock through a very fine strainer. Place in a pan and reduce until it coats the back of a spoon. Chop the chilled butter and stir into the reduced stock over a gentle heat, one lump at a time until melted and well incorporated.
Place the cooked dish in a clean earthenware dish. Cover with sauce, and leave to settle for 2 min. Then glaze under the grill. Arrange grapes in a pyramid for garnish and serve.

title: Fillets of sole veronique
